intro_text: Your patrol comes across a shrew.

success_text.unscathed_common: r_c drops into a crouch and stalks towards the shrew. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/pounce/pounces} on it, swiftly killing it with a bite to the back of the head.
success_text.unscathed_rare: r_c drops into a crouch and silently treads towards the shrew. At the last second, the shrew looks up, but r_c is quick to pounce and cut off its escape.
success_text.stat_skill: s_c drops into a perfect hunting crouch and stalks the oblivious shrew until {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/are/is} in striking distance. The shrew almost slips away, but s_c catches it with one paw and flings it towards {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} mouth for the killing bite.

fail_text.unscathed_common: Your patrol narrowly misses the shrew.

decline_text: Your patrol decides to look for other prey.

intro_text: The patrol looks around for something to disguise their scent while hunting.

success_text.unscathed_common: They can't think of anything that would work, but their hunt goes well regardless.
success_text.unscathed_rare: A snowy patch will do! The plan works and their hunt goes well.
success_text.stat_skill: s_c leads them to some moose dung on the slopes - it's not clean, but it's extremely effective, and the patrol hunts well.
success_text.stat_trait: s_c tells the patrol to roll in a patch of garlic to disguise their scent, which works perfectly. It's a funny taste to wash off their pelts though.

fail_text.unscathed_common: The patrol finds nothing to disguise their scent, and no prey either.
fail_text.unscathed_stat: The patrol finds no prey; it seems like all the prey was scared off because of their stench!

success_text.unscathed_common: {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} can't think of anything that would work, but {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} hunt goes well regardless.

intro_text: r_c's mentor assesses {PRONOUN/r_c/object} by sending {PRONOUN/r_c/object} on a solo hunt.
decline_text: r_c asks {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mentor to do the assessment some other time.

success_text.unscathed_common: r_c manages a skillful catch, and brings it back to the camp to show everyone!
success_text.unscathed_rare: r_c focuses completely on {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} test, slipping into a clear-eyed, razor focused routine of catch and stash, catch and stash. Eventually {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} caught enough to need {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mentor's help carrying it back to camp, and the feeling seeing {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} prey stock the fresh-kill pile - {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/feel/feels} ready to burst with happiness!
success_text.stat_trait: It's a terrible day for hunting, the prey running sparse and alert. But s_c takes {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} time and doesn't let the conditions discourage {PRONOUN/s_c/object}, until eventually the perfect opportunity falls into place and {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/pull/pulls} off a perfect catch!

fail_text.unscathed_common: Hunting is poor, and while r_c's mentor is disappointed, they don't expect r_c to be able to catch what isn't there.
fail_text.unscathed_stat: s_c is too hasty, bouncing after first one prey, then another, and it ends with {PRONOUN/s_c/object} empty pawed and exhausted. {PRONOUN/s_c/poss/CAP} mentor is disappointed - {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} clearly need more training.
fail_text.injury: During the hunt, r_c tumbles right down a steep slope while {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} attention is elsewhere. Bruised and sore, r_c has to report to the medicine cat den when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/return/returns} to camp.

history_text.scar: r_c got injured as an apprentice, exploring alone.

intro_text: r_c heads out onto the mountains alone, wanting to sink {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} teeth into some prey and have some time to {PRONOUN/r_c/self}.
decline_text: r_c turns back to camp, deciding that a group hunt would be more effective.

success_text.unscathed_common: r_c heads off to one of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} favorite spots in the mountains, a gully with stepped ridges running up and down its sides providing excellent ambush chances. And what do you know, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/are/is} bush! Or {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/were/was} as far as that ground squirrel thought.
success_text.unscathed_rare: r_c finds a fat, dumb, slow rabbit, and {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can barely drag the thing back to camp, but by the stars it's juicy when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/sit/sits} down to eat it with {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} Clanmates.
success_text.stat_skill: s_c gets the chance to try out an idea {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/have/has} been sitting on for a while. There's a nest of pika that {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/have/has} spotted that's particularly badly built, and {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/manage/manages} to dig down into one of the dens, fishing out small rodents by the pawful.
success_text.stat_trait: The prey is running terribly today. But s_c has patience, and wisely waits for the perfect opportunity instead of getting frustrated. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/come/comes} back to camp with a good contribution to the Clan's stores, having had a relaxing day sitting with {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} thoughts while waiting for the prey to come to {PRONOUN/s_c/object}.

fail_text.unscathed_common: You can't catch what isn't there, and the prey today is very not there.
fail_text.unscathed_stat: s_c starts the day with endless energy, but as one hunt fails after another, it very quickly runs dry. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/come/comes} back to camp, empty pawed and prickling with frustration.

intro_text: As the patrol is checking the border lines, they hear an odd sound coming from just beyond a rock fall.
decline_text: It's probably nothing. The patrol leaves the noise alone and continues on their way.

success_text.unscathed_common: r_c drops down into a hunting crouch, certain that a mouse must be the source of the noise. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/find/finds} {PRONOUN/r_c/self} to be correct when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/pounce/pounces} across the rocks and {VERB/r_c/return/returns} to the patrol with the tasty morsel dangling from {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mouth.
success_text.stat_skill: p_l pads towards the rock fall to check on the noise when a rabbit suddenly bursts out! s_c is quick to react and manages to snag the rabbit before it can disappear.

fail_text.unscathed_common: p_l pads towards the rock fall to check on the noise when a rabbit suddenly bursts out! None of the cats are quick enough to catch it, but at least the noise was nothing dangerous.
fail_text.unscathed_stat: s_c doesn't even hesitate before splitting from the patrol to check on the source of the noise. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} quickly {VERB/s_c/regret/regrets} {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} impulsivity, however, when an angry weasel bursts across the rocks, chattering loudly! s_c gets quite the scare, but thankfully the weasel only wanted to get away from {PRONOUN/s_c/object} and quickly runs off back behind the rocks.
fail_text.injury: r_c takes the lead in checking the source of the noise and comes face to face with an angry fox! Though {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/backpedal/backpedals} rapidly, the fox still manages to take a bite out of {PRONOUN/r_c/object} before the rest of the patrol can back {PRONOUN/r_c/object} up.

history_text.scar: p_l gained a scar from a fox.

intro_text: r_c encounters a swarm of Twolegs, gathered at the foot of the mountain.
decline_text: Your patrol decides to hunt elsewhere.

success_text.unscathed_common: r_c immediately turns and heads for home to report this to {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} leader, alarmed by the sudden presence of Twolegs in their territory.
success_text.unscathed_rare: Slyly, r_c uses the unusual presence of the weird Twoleg to help {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} hunt, hiding on the outskirts of the area and waiting for the Twolegs to flush prey towards {PRONOUN/r_c/object}. It works, and {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/leave/leaves} the Twolegs to their business.
success_text.stat_skill: s_c spots the Twolegs unloading metal boxes from their monsters, and recognizes that it can't be anything good, leaving immediately.
success_text.stat_trait: s_c spits in the Twolegs' direction and decides to pick a different place to hunt.

fail_text.death: r_c mostly ignores the Twolegs as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/hunt/hunts}, crawling into a metal box to follow the scent of food. But when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/try/tries} to back up, the way is blocked, and there's nothing {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can do - eventually the Twolegs notice, and r_c is taken by them.
fail_text.stat_death: s_c has heard terrible things about Twolegs, but {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} still {VERB/s_c/creep/creeps} closer when one falls and starts yowling with pain. It's a mistake, and a trap snaps shut around {PRONOUN/s_c/object}. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/are/is} taken out of the mountains with the injured Twoleg.

success_text.stat_trait: s_c stops anyone from going near the Twolegs, repeating that true warriors have nothing to do with Twolegs and their monsters, and the patrol leaves back up the mountain.

intro_text: The patrol comes across a Thunderpath running through the mountains.
decline_text: They decide it is better not to cross.

success_text.unscathed_common: Your patrol waits until they can hear the wind whistling, not a murmur of a monster, and crosses the Thunderpath to hunt on the other side.
success_text.unscathed_rare: Your patrol finds a pipe running under the Thunderpath and uses it to cross. They end up with slightly damp paws, but a successful haul of prey.
success_text.stat_skill: Your patrol stops on the edge of the Thunderpath, and s_c organizes a thorough search that finds a flattened squirrel. It's a reminder of the danger of the Thunderpath, and a good source of scavenged meat.
success_text.stat_trait: s_c is patient enough to wait until the Thunderpath is completely clear, then trots across calmly to hunt on the other side. The mountains have so few monsters passing through anyway, there's no need to be hasty.

fail_text.unscathed_common: r_c hears a monster thundering towards {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, but it screeches to a halt just in time. That was close! Maybe it's best to go back to camp.
fail_text.death: r_c is hit by a monster while crossing and dies instantly. c_n is shaken by the death, and it's a reminder to every cat that just because their territory contains few Thunderpaths doesn't mean they can forget their dangers.
fail_text.injury: r_c is hit by a monster and seems quite injured, but miraculously still alive. c_n is shaken by the incident, and it's a reminder to every cat that just because their territory contains few Thunderpaths doesn't mean they can forget their dangers.

history_text.scar: r_c was heavily injured by a monster, and carries the scars from it.
history_text.reg_death: r_c was hit by a monster and killed.
